member.name: T:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraPositionMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to position the camera in a 3D scene.
member.remarks:
This enumeration defines the two primary modes for camera positioning:
FocalPoint Positions the camera based on a focal point in the scene, typically used for targeting a specific object or area.
CameraLocation Positions the camera based on the camera's location, often used for first-person or free-camera perspectives.
Use this enumeration to configure how the camera interacts with the scene, depending on the desired perspective or interaction model.

member.name: T:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to determine how the camera targets or interacts with entities or the scene.
member.remarks:
This enumeration defines the primary modes for camera targeting:
FollowTarget The camera follows a target entity, maintaining a specified distance and angle. This is commonly used for third-person or chase camera perspectives.
StaticPosition The camera remains in a fixed position and does not follow any target entity. This is useful for cutscenes or overview perspectives.
GestureDriven The camera is controlled by user gestures, allowing for free interaction. This is often used in touch-based or VR environments.

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode.Follow

member.name: F:GameCore.CameraSystem.Enum.CameraTargetingMode.Static
